cool, thanks Jim. How many tsuba would have been solid gold ?. I am not going to remember the smith but there is a lovely gold foiled/sheet ? plated tsuba ( I think ) in Comptons 100 famous swords. Part of a complete set of koshirae I believe. It features paulownia flowers over waves from memory.

Rich
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: yamaimojg 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, November 13, 2003 7:50 AM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: This is pretty funny


  Rich,
  The tsuba in the background of that page is a solid gold Umetada 
  tsuba owned by a friend.  It was on display at the London shinsa (but 
  without the music).  
  Jim

  --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Richard Turner" <ikkanshi@w...> 
  wrote:
  > Sorry all, it was funny but not meant to go to this address. 
  multiple addresses in the reply to got me.

  > 
  > Rich
